landscapeHeroImage.altText: Downton abbey a new era sp hero

posterImages.altText: Downton abbey a new era sp poster

show.title: Back to the Future
show.headline: 1.21 gigawatts of pure cinematic bliss

event.title: <show-title>Back to the Future</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Come get heavy with Marty and Doc
event.description:
"1.21 gigawatts!”

Over 30 years ago, Michael J. Fox and Christopher Lloyd took us on an era-hopping adventure with BACK TO THE FUTURE as the '80s raddest time travelin' teen and his unlikely sidekick - a crazy, wild-eyed, wild-haired scientist. What rose from those flame trails is the heaviest sci-fi comedy ever made - one that is often considered "the perfect movie" without hyperbole.

Now, you’re invited to get even heavier with us at these fourth wall-busting celebrations of time-hopping DeLoreans, life jacket vests, and oedipal overtones. Come floor it with us right to 88 MPH with a Johnny B. Goode air guitar contest before the show, and themed props to bring the movie magic to life, like your very own vial of Plutonium!**

**Not guaranteed to actually transport you back in time.

It’s the raucously fun celebration you might not be ready for, but your kids – your kids are gonna love it.

show.title: Selena
show.headline: Jennifer Lopez plays the queen of Tejano music

event.title: <show-title>Selena</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Feel the bidi bidi bom bom at this interactive screening
event.description:
Join us at this very special Movie Party as we celebrate the life and music of one of America’s most beloved icons, Selena Quintanilla-Pérez. Sure, we could just sit quietly and watch the magnificent 1997 film SELENA, starring Jennifer Lopez in a star-making performance. But we think the best way to honor Selena is to share in the joy of her music.

Whether you want to sing along or use any of the fun props we’ll have available when you arrive, you are strongly encouraged to lose yourself in all of Selena's classic songs while you enjoy the film. So throw on a rhinestone bra... oops, we mean bustier, and join us for a fun-filled night full of bidi bidi bom bom.

event.title: <show-title>Downton Abbey: A New Era</show-title> <event-type-title>Early Access</event-type-title>
event.headline: You are cordially invited to an advance screening – formal attire required
event.description: We would be honoured to host you and other Downton Abbey enthusiasts at an exclusive advance screening. You’ll see it before anyone else, but be sure to wear your finest formal attire. We won’t turn you away if you’re wearing jeans, but we will shoot disapproving looks and pointed barbs your way all night if you do. We’ll have a special themed menu of light refreshments available to order from, and all guests will receive a limited-run print of a custom-designed letterpress recipe card.

show.title: Hot Fuzz
show.headline: Edgar Wright's silly deconstruction of the buddy cop genre

event.title: <show-title>Hot Fuzz</show-title> <event-type-title>15th Anniversary Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Big Cops. Small Town. Moderate Violence.
event.description:
By the power of Greyskull, join us for an interactive 15th anniversary celebration of director Edgar Wright’s balls-to-the-wall supercop comedy masterpiece, HOT FUZZ! Edgar Wright and his collaborators Simon Pegg and Nick Frost do to action cinema what they did to horror in SHAUN OF THE DEAD: They walk the cleverest of lines between homage, parody, and downright badass awesomeness. And when you model yourself after movies like POINT BREAK and BAD BOYS II, how could the results be anything but spectacular?

At these interactive “Movie Party” shows you’ll experience the awesomeness of Edgar Wright’s action-comedy with pre-movie shenanigans, themed props, and a conspiracy of surprises. Deal with it.

show.title: Dirty Dancing
show.headline: Nobody puts baby in a corner

show.title: Shogun Assassin
show.headline: Blood spattered samurai mayhem!

event.title: <show-title>Shogun Assassin</show-title>
event.headline: Blood spattered samurai mayhem!
event.description: A bad time for the empire made for a good time for western audiences who in 1980 were treated to this arterial spray soaked 85-minute distillation of two feature length Japanese movies from 1972 based on the Lone Wolf and Cub manga series. A re-cut, condensed, dubbed version of multiple foreign movies based on a comic book sounds like it'd be a hot mess, but through some magic alchemy (and the addition of a bumping, new analog synth soundtrack) SHOGUN ASSASSIN stands as a uniquely badass work of its own. Ogami the Lone Wolf is a master samurai whose prowess and very existence threaten the paranoid Shogun. The Shogun sentences Ogami to death and murders his wife forcing him to flee across the country with his toddler son, consumed with rage and desire for vengeance. The outlaw samurai roams the countryside pushing his child around in a baby carriage and dismembering, disemboweling, and decapitating anyone who gets in his way. The compact story rarely pauses for story or character development and instead relishes in showing conflict after conflict between Ogami and the colorful group of would-be assassins that greet him around every corner. Blades fly and bright red blood squirts from so many necks, stumps and faces as he carves his way across feudal Japan. This is the stuff dreams are made of. (Laird Jimenez)

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Poltergeist (1982)
show.headline: PG-rated horror has never been so scary.

event.title: <show-title>Poltergeist (1982)</show-title>
event.headline: PG-rated horror has never been so scary
event.description:
"They're here!"

Forty years ago, Steven Spielberg harvested some of his unused ideas from a pre-E.T. alien invasion film about an ordinary family pitted against the unknown, added in some supernatural elements from his darkest fears, and hired Tobe Hooper to direct. The result is the all-time American horror classic, POLTERGEIST - screening this May via a gorgeous new 4K restoration courtesy of Warner Brothers.

JoBeth Williams and Craig T. Nelson star as the Freelings, whose average suburban family is tested when unexplained phenomena begin to manifest in their house. What begins as curiosity turns to terror when their young daughter (played wonderfully by Heather O'Rourke) goes missing. Together, the family must rally their strength to rescue the child from the demonic entity preying upon their home.

Don't miss a fortieth-anniversary screening of one of the greatest ghost movies ever made. There's a reason this movie is a classic, folks.

show.title: Kiki's Delivery Service (Subtitled)
show.headline: A young witch supports herself by running an air courier service

show.title: Dirty Dancing
show.headline: Nobody puts baby in a corner

event.title: <show-title>Dirty Dancing</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Sway along with Swayze at our interactive movie party
event.description:
When DIRTY DANCING came out in 1987, it changed lives. Baby and Johnny showed the world the power of dance, the power of love, and most importantly, the power of a shirtless and swingin' Patrick Swayze.

This film set the standard not only for dance movies but for romance in general – and more than 30 years later, we still dream of nailing that lift. And here at Alamo Drafthouse, there's no better place to celebrate Baby and Johnny, where you're encouraged to quote, sing, and dance along at this Movie Party screening. You'll also receive themed props, like your own key to the Catskills and a watermelon that you can carry (don’t worry, it’s light!)

So, move like the wind and join us for the time of your life at Kellerman's, where absolutely no one will be put in a corner.

show.title: Christine (1983)
show.headline: Body by Plymouth. Soul by Satan.

event.title: <show-title>Christine (1983)</show-title>
event.headline: Body by Plymouth. Soul by Satan.
event.description:
We're revving up engines in salute of John Carpenter's CHRISTINE.

When Arnie, a teenage outcast played by Keith Gordon, buys a new car, he falls head(lights) over heels for the 1958 Plymouth Fury. The kicker? The car is devoted to Arnie as well - running down anybody who comes between the cruiser and her guy. Carpenter's slick-as-sin adaptation of Stephen King's killer car carnage ride sees the horror masters combine their skills for a winning balance of stellar special effects and heart tugging character work, combined with a (predictably) incredible soundtrack, and CHRISTINE is a blast from head to spoiler. Don't miss this gorgeous 4K restoration of CHRISTINE.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

The assisted listening headset provides an amplified audio signal for those individuals who are hard of hearing. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available to drive hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants.
You may not enter a movie after it has started. If you show up to your desired screening late, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or for a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages including babies are welcome with parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! Standard (1701)
agePolicies.description:
Children ages 3+ admitted before 6pm.
Children ages 6+ admitted after 6pm.
All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult.

agePolicies.name: Rated G
agePolicies.description: Guests under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children 3 and up allowed for shows that start before 6pm. Ages 6 and up after 6pm.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG
agePolicies.description: Guests under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children 3 and up allowed for shows that start before 6pm. Ages 6 and up after 6pm.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG-13 (Standard) (1701)
agePolicies.description: 18 and up. Guests ages 6-17 are welcome any time with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG with Adult Focus (1701)
agePolicies.description: 18 and up. Guests ages 6-17 are welcome any time with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: Rated R (1701)
agePolicies.description: 18 and up. Guests ages 6-17 are welcome any time with a parent or guardian.
